p: Several national and regional compilations of medicinal plants exist in Mexico, covering over 3,000 botanical taxa ( Argueta and Zolla, 1994; Bye etÂ al., 1995). Unfortunately, these often demonstrate serious methodological deficits, particularly in regard to taxonomic identification and interpretation of ethnomedical data ( Bye and Linares, 2015, p. 396-397). Further, the lacking quantification of traditional uses limit the utility of these compilations for the identification of cross-culturally salient taxa.
